profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Augusta, Ga., February 1, 1788; attended Princeton College; studied law; by a special act of the legislature was admitted to the bar in 1808; commenced practice in Milledgeville, Ga.; appointed solicitor general of the Ocmulgee circuit in September 1817; solicitor general of Georgia in 1823; one of the commissioners appointed to investigate the disturbances in the Creek Nation; moved to Columbus, Ga., in 1827; elected as a Jacksonian to the Twenty-third Congress (March 4, 1833-March 3, 1835); elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-ninth Congress (March 4, 1845-March 3, 1847); died in Columbus, Ga., March 18, 1864; interment in Linnwood Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In File II Names/Pre-1800 and File II Names.
researchRecord.description: File is primarily incoming correspondence to the Governor of Georgia. Finding aid in repository.

recordLocation.name: Georgia Department of Archives and History

researchRecord.name: 1800-?, 37 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains personal papers and correspondence. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: 1761-1847, 169 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains legal and personal correspondence and other papers, chiefly concerning cases in Georgia courts. Partial card index.

researchRecord.name: In the papers of Edward Telfair, 1762-1831, 911 items.
In the Henry Benning-Seaborn Jones collection.
researchRecord.description: The bulk of the collection deals with the financial transactions of (and especially debts owed to) Seaborn Jones and the records of his (and to a lesser degree Benning's) law practice.
